title.value: TGB 2.0: A Benchmark for Learning on Temporal Knowledge Graphs and Heterogeneous Graphs
title.justification: The title 'TGB 2.0: A Benchmark for Learning on Temporal Knowledge Graphs and Heterogeneous Graphs' is explicitly mentioned in the heading of the paper, indicating the primary focus and novelty of the research.
title.quote: TGB 2.0: A Benchmark for Learning on Temporal Knowledge Graphs and Heterogeneous Graphs

extractions.description: This paper introduces Temporal Graph Benchmark 2.0 (TGB 2.0), which is a novel benchmarking framework designed to evaluate methods for predicting future links on Temporal Knowledge Graphs and Temporal Heterogeneous Graphs. It emphasizes large-scale datasets and provides eight new datasets for comprehensive evaluations. The paper addresses challenges related to evaluation inconsistencies and limited dataset sizes in previous benchmarks.

type.justification: The nature of the paper is empirical as it introduces a benchmarking framework for evaluating various models on large datasets, conducting experiments to analyze their performance and draw experimental insights.
type.quote: Through extensive experimentation, we observe that 1) leveraging edge-type information is crucial to obtain high performance, 2) simple heuristic baselines are often competitive with more complex methods, 3) most methods fail to run on our largest datasets, highlighting the need for research on more scalable methods.

name.justification: The paper focuses on learning from temporal knowledge graphs and heterogeneous graphs, which falls under the domain of graph learning and machine learning on graphs.
name.quote: Learning from graph-structured data has become ubiquitous in many applications... These complex interactions and temporal dependencies can be captured by multi-relational temporal graphs.

name.justification: The paper specifically addresses learning tasks related to temporal graphs, including temporal knowledge graphs and temporal heterogeneous graphs.
name.quote: These approaches capture the rich information from multi-relational data, forming distinct lines of research from those of single-relational temporal graphs.

name.justification: Temporal Knowledge Graphs are a focal point of the paper, distinguishing it from other types of graphs.
name.quote: These complex interactions and temporal dependencies can be captured by multi-relational temporal graphs. In recent years, various approaches have emerged to predict future links in such graphs... for prediction on Temporal Knowledge Graphs (TKGs).

name.justification: Part of the research focuses on Temporal Heterogeneous Graphs, expanding on the standard heterogeneous graphs notion by incorporating temporal elements.
name.quote: These approaches capture the rich information from multi-relational data, forming distinct lines of research from those of single-relational temporal graphs... for prediction on Temporal Heterogeneous Graphs (THGs).

name.justification: RE-GCN is explicitly mentioned as one of the models used in experiments for temporal knowledge graph learning.
name.quote: For TKG experiments, we include RE-GCN.

is_contributed.justification: While the paper uses RE-GCN in its evaluations, it does not claim to have developed the model.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed as part of the experiments conducted within the study.
is_executed.quote: For TKG experiments, we include RE-GCN [41], TLogic [47], CEN [39] as well as two deterministic heuristic baselines...

is_compared.justification: The performance of RE-GCN is compared to other models within the scope of the paper's experiments.
is_compared.quote: The results reveal that no single method exhibits superior performance across all four datasets. Surprisingly, the RecB heuristic performs competitively across most datasets while being among the best performing on tkgl-smallpedia and tkgl-icews.

referenced_paper_title.value: Simplifying temporal heterogeneous network for continuous-time link prediction
referenced_paper_title.justification: STHN's development is recorded in the cited paper, which the primary work references.
referenced_paper_title.quote: STHN [38] utilizes a link encoder and patching techniques to incorporate edge type and time information respectively.

name.justification: The paper describes tkgl-smallpedia as one of the novel Temporal Knowledge Graph datasets introduced for evaluating future link predictions.
name.quote: tkgl-smallpedia. This TKG dataset is constructed from the Wikidata Knowledge Graph...

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific reference provided for a paper title, indicating it is a new dataset presented in this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: tkgl-smallpedia. This TKG dataset is constructed from the Wikidata Knowledge Graph...

name.justification: The paper introduces tkgl-polecat as a new dataset based on the POLECAT data, explicitly mentioning its composition and use-case.
name.quote: tkgl-polecat. This TKG dataset is based on the POLitical Event Classification, Attributes, and Types (POLECAT) dataset...

referenced_paper_title.quote: tkgl-polecat. This TKG dataset is based on the POLitical Event Classification, Attributes, and Types (POLECAT) dataset...

name.justification: tkgl-icews is included as a Temporal Knowledge Graph proposed in the paper, extracted from known political event datasets.
name.quote: tkgl-icews. This TKG dataset is extracted from the ICEWS Coded Event Data which spans a time frame from 1995 to 2022.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is extracted as per this paper's goals, not relying on a separate reference title.
referenced_paper_title.quote: tkgl-icews. This TKG dataset is extracted from the ICEWS Coded Event Data...

name.justification: Tkgl-wikidata is one of the datasets contributed in the paper; being described as a large set extracted from Wikidata with explicit temporal relations.
name.quote: tkgl-wikidata. This TKG dataset is extracted from the Wikidata KG and constitutes a superset of tkgl-smallpedia.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The work introduces tkgl-wikidata, so there isn't a prior reference, reflecting its contribution to the benchmark introduced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: tkgl-wikidata. This TKG dataset is extracted from the Wikidata KG...

name.justification: The thgl-software dataset is part of the eight new datasets presented in the paper as a Temporal Heterogeneous Graph resource.
name.quote: thgl-software. This THG dataset is based on Github data collected by GH Arxiv.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There isn't a distinct prior reference for this dataset, noting it as a contribution inherent to this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: thgl-software. This THG dataset is based on Github data collected by GH Arxiv.

name.justification: Introduced in the paper, thgl-forum describes interactions derived from Reddit's user and subreddit networks, tailored for Heterogeneous Graph analysis.
name.quote: thgl-forum. This THG dataset is based on the user and subreddit interaction network on Reddit...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The unique collection process of the dataset emphasizes its contribution without a preceding reference.
referenced_paper_title.quote: thgl-forum. This THG dataset is based on the user and subreddit interaction network on Reddit [54].

name.justification: The Myket dataset's inclusion as thgl-myket indicates its construction as part of the novel frameworks tailored for Temporal Heterogeneous Graphs.
name.quote: thgl-myket. This THG dataset is based on the Myket Android App market...

referenced_paper_title.quote: thgl-myket. This THG dataset is based on the Myket Android App market.

name.justification: The dataset thgl-github is noted as being curated for this paper, derived from GH Arxiv data to expand on heterogeneous time-variant interactions.
